radiographic_examinations.findings: Impaired inspiration and an ill-defined, patchy density, 1.5 cm in diameter, in the middle lobe of the right lung.
Bilateral nodular opacities, the largest of which was 2 cm in diameter in the right lower lobe; bilateral ground-glass opacities and septal thickening.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Pulmonary nodules appeared to have increased in size in the right upper and lower lobes but regressed in the right middle lobe.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse ground-glass opacities in both lungs and diffuse septal thickening, with irregular pulmonary nodules in the right upper and lower lobes.
Abnormal perfusion with irregular distribution of the tracer and several segmental and subsegmental perfusion defects.
Diffuse hazy opacities in both lungs, with indistinct vessels and poorly defined nodular opacities in the right lung.
Diffuse ground-glass opacification throughout both lungs, bilateral diffuse interlobular septal thickening, and irregular nodular opacities in the right upper and lower lung zones.
